latest.title: Requisition Notice
latest.content:
Today 09:30
RNS Number : 2926R
Satsuma Technology PLC
02 February 2026
2 February 2026
Satsuma Technology PLC
('Satsuma' or the 'Company')
Requisition Notice
Satsuma Technology PLC (LSE: SATS) confirms that, further to the announcement made on 28 January 2026, the Board has been advised that the Company has received sufficient requests from its members to satisfy the threshold in section 303(2) of the Companies Act 2006. The directors are therefore required to call a general meeting of the Company in accordance with section 304 of the Companies Act 2006.
The Board is aware that it appears there is currently support for the proposed resolutions from a majority of the Company's beneficial shareholders.
The Board will act in accordance with its statutory obligations and will make a further announcement in due course.
Shareholders are advised to take no action at this time.
Satsuma Technology PLC
Data Counsel
Steffan Williams
William Barker
via Data Counsel
satsuma@datacounsel.uk

latest.title: Purported Requisition Notice
latest.content:
Today 16:10
RNS Number : 7861Q
Satsuma Technology PLC
28 January 2026
28 January 2026
Satsuma Technology PLC
('Satsuma' or the 'Company')
Purported Requisition Notice
Satsuma Technology PLC (LSE: SATS) announces that it has received a purported requisition notice ("the Notice") from Shard Capital, requesting the Company's board of directors (the "Board") to convene a general meeting ("Requisitioned GM") under section 303(1) of the Companies Act 2006.
The Notice sets out four Ordinary Resolutions (the "Resolutions") to be proposed at the Requisitioned GM:
1. Immediate termination of the appointment of Henry Elder as a director and officer of the Company;
2. Immediate termination of appointment of Andrew Smith as a director and officer of the Company;
3. Immediate appointment of Nicholas Lee as non-executive director and officer of the Company; and
4. Immediate appointment of Paddy Dean as non-executive director and officer of the Company.
The Notice states that it has been signed by shareholders representing 49.3% per cent. of the Company's issued share capital and that these shareholders have undertaken to vote in favour of the above resolutions at the Requisitioned GM. The Board notes that no information has been provided to them on either Nicholas Lee or Paddy Dean.
The Board is currently consulting its advisers to determine, inter alia, the validity of the Notice and is verifying the percentage of shareholders who have signed it and given the undertakings. A further announcement will be made in due course.
Shareholders are advised to take no action at this time.
Ranald McGregor-Smith, Chair, commented:
"We view the actions of the requisitionists as unnecessary, a distraction from a number of strategic initiatives that have commenced since becoming the first BTC company to obtain a full listing, and not in the best interests of the Company. We remain fully supportive of both Henry and Andy and I will be engaging with shareholders in due course."
Satsuma Technology PLC
Data Counsel
Steffan Williams
William Barker
via Data Counsel
satsuma@datacounsel.uk
This information is provided by RNS, the news service of the London Stock Exchange. RNS is approved by the Financial Conduct Authority to act as a Primary Information Provider in the United Kingdom. Terms and conditions relating to the use and distribution of this information may apply. For further information, please contact

company_30s.what_they_do: SATS Ltd. is a small trading platform that offers a limited range of digital asset services to retail customers.
company_30s.why_they_matter: Its niche focus on micro‑cap cryptocurrency exposure could appeal to investors looking for high‑risk, high‑reward playbooks, but the market for such services remains thin.
company_30s.current_state: The company is currently trading at zero pence after a dramatic collapse from its peak and has yet to generate any meaningful revenue.

rns_narrative: Listing events: The company has recently been admitted to trading on the AIM, filed PDMR holdings, and updated its prospectus, signalling a formal entry into public markets.
Financial updates: An unaudited interim report and a non‑statutory update were issued in November, offering a glimpse of the company’s cash position but no revenue figures.
Corporate governance: A board change proposal and the sale of a small Bitcoin holding were announced in December, hinting at a shift in strategy but lacking substantive detail.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: The community remains silent, with no clear narrative emerging from the handful of posts that surface on ShareChat.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: A few traders speculate that the listing and board changes could unlock a fresh capital raise that might revive the platform’s prospects.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: Others warn that the absence of any revenue, combined with the zero‑pence price, suggests the company is a speculative bubble waiting to burst.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: Initially there was a brief spike of excitement around the listing, but sentiment quickly cooled as no tangible progress was announced.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends shows a flat line of interest, with searches never exceeding a baseline of zero and no discernible surge. Social media volume is essentially nil, indicating the story has lost oxygen and is unlikely to reignite without a concrete event.

near_term_catalysts: Next quarterly filing in March could disclose the first revenue figure; a positive surprise would be a critical turning point for the bull case.
An AGM in May may involve a vote on new capital structure or a strategic pivot, offering a potential catalyst if the board signals a clear direction.
expect_next.watch_for: Keep an eye on any director share sales, sudden placement announcements, or a sudden spike in trading volume. The bull case hinges on revenue confirmation; any sign of dilution or further capital needs could tip the balance.
expect_next.timing_regime: APEX labels the current regime as Exhausted—technical support is weak, volatility is nil, and the price has already collapsed. Entry timing would need to be opportunistic and heavily reliant on a surprise catalyst.

buy_vs_sell.bull_case: If the company can suddenly announce first‑time revenue or secure a sizeable placement at a discount, the price could rally modestly, offering a small upside for a cautious, high‑risk player.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: The lack of any financial traction, zero trading volume, and a price that has already fallen 98.9% from its peak make a recovery unlikely. Any further dilution or negative news would almost certainly push the price lower.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: The risk/reward profile is poor: a potential 10% upside is outweighed by a 90% probability of a deeper decline, making the position unattractive for most traders.

playbook.if_bullish: If you decide to take a speculative position, limit your stake to 1–2% of your portfolio, use a tight stop at 0.02p to cap losses, and add only if a revenue announcement arrives.
playbook.if_watching: Hold off until the next quarterly report. If the company reports any positive cash flow or a credible capital raise, consider entering on a dip but stay ready to exit if sentiment turns negative.
playbook.if_passing: Given the complete absence of buzz, the collapse in price, and the lack of any tangible catalyst, it is safest to stay out. Focus on better‑structured micro‑cap opportunities with clearer fundamentals.

ai_insights.bottom_line: Pass on SATS Ltd. today. The story has died, the price is at zero, and there is no credible catalyst to spark a rebound.
